abstract.text: Creates a regex component that matches an ISO 8601-formatted date string that includes a time zone component, capturing the matched substring as a Foundation date.

inlineContent.text: A Boolean value that specifies whether the source string contains fractional seconds. The default is
The character that separates year, month, and day sections of the date substring. The default is
The character that separates the date and time sections of the substring. The default is
The character that separates the date and time sections of the substring. The default is
The character that separates the hour, minute, and second sections of the substring. The default is
that matches ISO 8601-formatted date substrings as Foundation
This method matches an ISO 8601 date string using the provided separator characters.

that matches an ISO 8601-formatted date. The format looks for a dash for the date separator, the standard date/time separator (none), a colon for the time separator, and no separator for the time zone. It then matches this regex against a source string containing a date with this format (specifying a time zone five hours behind UTC), some whitespace, a substring, more whitespace, and a currency value.

code: let date = match?.1 // date == Jul 14, 2022 at 7:10 PM (may vary depending on current locale)

abstract.text: Build apps using a powerful open language.
A value type whose instances are either
or
A regular expression.
A type that represents a regular expression.
Creates a regex component that matches a localized date string formatted in accordance with a style, capturing it as a Foundation date.
Creates a regex component that matches a localized date string formatted in accordance with a format string, capturing it as a Foundation date.
Creates a regex component that matches a localized date and time string, capturing it as a Foundation date.
A regex component that matches a default ISO 8601-formatted date string, capturing it as a Foundation date.
Creates a regex component that matches an ISO 8601-formatted date string, capturing the matched substring as a Foundation date in the specified time zone.
Creates a regex component that matches an ISO 8601-formatted date string, capturing it as a Foundation date in the specified time zone.
Creates a regex component that matches an ISO 8601-formatted date string that includes a time zone component, capturing the matched substring as a Foundation date.
A specific point in time, independent of any calendar or time zone.
Specifies a dash character separating year, month, and day components in an ISO 8601 date format style.
Specifies no separator between the date and time components in an ISO 8601 date format style.
Specifies a colon character separating the time components in an ISO 8601 date format style.
A specific point in time, independent of any calendar or time zone.
A type that converts between dates and their ISO-8601 string representations.
Type describing the character separating the date and time components of a date in an ISO 8601 date format.
A type describing the character separating year, month, and day components of a date in an ISO 8601 date format.
Type describing the character separating the time components of a date in an ISO 8601 date format.
A type describing the character separating the time and time zone of a date in an ISO 8601 date format.
